commit_message:
Add comments about how to adapt services for FFU

It can be confusing to adapt the changes on resource_registry
for sevices between puppet and docker, add comments on how to
do it properly. Also add missing change about VhostuserSocketGroup
change.

Change-Id: Ib4038138b33c8e85b9038f5f59152222f3b524fe

commit_message:
Use ansible module instead of command

This uses the os_client_config module to make sure the openstack
cloud configuration is well setup on the appropriate nodes.

commit_message:
WSGI Neutron integration

This patch provides a new mechanism to deploy Neutron using
WSGI script. This also starts a Neutron RPC server process
when the Neutron API is loaded via a WSGI entry point to
serve the agents.

Co-Authored-By: Victor Morales <victor.morales@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <AnNP@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I16a199b04858bfc03ef50d9883154dba8b0d66ea
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580049/
Partially-implements: blueprint run-in-wsgi-server

commit_message:
Take WSGIScriptAlias into account in docker healthcheck.

Some services running as vhost, as nova_placement make
use of an  alias in which the wsgi service is mapped.
Currently, the nova_placement healthcheck has hardcoded
the alias in the curl [0] request, but if this alias
changes or other service modifies its from / to another,
then the check will start failing again.

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/master/healthcheck/nova-placement#L6

Change-Id: I5a325be424740e80eafd6b4abd8eb4b3111740aa
Closes-Bug: #1781623
(cherry picked from commit f1a1c324fb149d40c960f1eaba650f0e8c71d91e)

commit_message:
Flatten tests directory

Looking at the structuring of API and scenario tests among Tempest
plugins, almost none of them places tests for different APIs into
individual directories such as: flavors, limits etc.. In particular, such
convention does not occur in the Tempest repository, on which plugins
should be modeled. In order to comply with Tempest standards and improve
exploreability, this change flattens tests directory.

Change-Id: I579a37aa736e2cfa677c0b38fcf89afb67413d7d
Signed-off-by: Bartosz Zurkowski <b.zurkowski@samsung.com>

subject: Simplify inserting apt keys into LXC image
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-08-06 08:54:05.000000000', 'files': ['vars/ubuntu-18.04.yml', 'templates/prep-scripts/ubuntu_18_prep.sh.j2'], 'message': 'Simplify inserting apt keys into LXC image

Bionic requires a functioning gpg-agent to run apt-key add. This means
that gpg-agent must be working properly in the chroot when the lxc image
preparation script runs.

Previous changes [1] have enabled apt-key to communicate with gpg-agent
during the lxc_hosts role checks, however the cache prep fails almost
every time when lxc_hosts is used within other role checks.

This is not a new issue, debian-installer is affected too [2].

This change adopts the same route as d-i, and simply copies the host
/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d directory to the LXC image, removing the
need for apt-key and in turn gpg-agent.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588629/
[2] https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=851774

Change-Id: Ia511881f675cd88ecc58360b18531f0dac486b70
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify inserting apt keys into LXC image

Bionic requires a functioning gpg-agent to run apt-key add. This means
that gpg-agent must be working properly in the chroot when the lxc image
preparation script runs.

Previous changes [1] have enabled apt-key to communicate with gpg-agent
during the lxc_hosts role checks, however the cache prep fails almost
every time when lxc_hosts is used within other role checks.

This is not a new issue, debian-installer is affected too [2].

This change adopts the same route as d-i, and simply copies the host
/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d directory to the LXC image, removing the
need for apt-key and in turn gpg-agent.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588629/
[2] https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=851774

Change-Id: Ia511881f675cd88ecc58360b18531f0dac486b70

presently while genearting the hosts file and

Secondary nodes, in the cluster while trying to

commit_message:
Sets correct permission for /etc/hosts

presently while genearting the hosts file and
replacing the original one , the file permission is
replaced  with no access for world and ownership
changes from root to centos.

Secondary nodes, in the cluster while trying to
resolve primary host address can't  read the host
name and ip from hosts file and fails to connect.

This fix restores the hosts file permission correctly

Change-Id: Ia9b7e609644c93d13108af88aa3dacf94fc19ceb
Task: #23261
Story: #2003139
(cherry picked from commit fee5d179880c50de62bcd8bb32c833d8cdc9c419)

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-07-27 07:05:14.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/constants.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_ceph_upgrade/__init__.py', 'releasenotes/notes/drop-ceph-upgrade-run-8f28475bf6b0af65.yaml', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_ceph_upgrade/fakes.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_ceph_upgrade/test_overcloud_ceph_upgrade.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_ceph_upgrade.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Drop obsolete `overcloud ceph-upgrade run`

After switching from Heat workflow resources to external_deploy_tasks,

commit_message:
Drop obsolete `overcloud ceph-upgrade run`

After switching from Heat workflow resources to external_deploy_tasks,
the `ceph-upgrade run` command no longer works and can be
dropped. Instead we'll be using `external-update run` and
`external-upgrade run` commands.

Partial-Bug: #1783949
Change-Id: I228ce6228d0bd0bd4d40bc7a7cdd6bfe98a7a6ed

commit_message:
Update/upgrade commands for services with external installers

New `openstack overcloud external-update run` and `openstack overcloud
external-upgrade run` commands are defined. These are meant to perform
updates and upgrades for services deployed via
external_deploy_tasks. A separate command is used because external
installers don't fit well within the --nodes and --roles selection
pattern we've established for the normal `update run` and `upgrade
run` commands.

Partial-Bug: #1783949
Depends-On: Ib2474e8f69711cd6610a78884d5032ffd19ad249
Depends-On: I982032a0eadfbfb7f1eadee9cae26c8cd5fcdbba
Change-Id: Ib2f32ae8ac234b0c25b0e1ff1f8f8d8e041185e0

commit_message:
Fixes zuul issues

Some issues were not caught during the initial mock autospec
patch which was added to compute_hyperv, and now they're causing
some unit tests to fail. This patch fixes those issues.

Secondly, the docs job relies on tools/tox_install.sh to install
nova, but it is not passing the required arguments, causing it to
fail. This patch updates the script so it can properly execute.

Change-Id: I91cbadb2a05ee4880c3fa761696818ec95c40df2
(cherry picked from commit 48bb0d6b41b57ab29e8b2db73ede818812ade08e)

tests: uses oslotest as the test base

oslotest's base will add mock.patch.stopall, so we don't have to.

Change-Id: If13a465000648dfbf1e229a3b8d765e8b3204db4
(cherry picked from commit 8dd291019570c1a2b4f5b61cbebb50f166accf49)

Zun may integration these options.

commit_message:
Support health check for Docker containers

The docker has supported healthcheck. It is useful for application
container.
Zun may integration these options.

  --health-cmd Command to run to check health
  --health-interval Time between running the check
  --health-retries Consecutive failures needed to report unhealthy
  --health-timeout Maximum time to allow one check to run
  In zun, the four parameter are cmd, interval, retries, timeout.

Partial-Implements: blueprint support-healthycheck

Change-Id: I1f4f6a5536a33ecb9ac9c032b119a9349e3616ee

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-08 14:59:51.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ibb8ce8e655643161b0b7d4e84f0c2897e9c6417c
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ibb8ce8e655643161b0b7d4e84f0c2897e9c6417c

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I90c548df545990a4575628d918f2bce72071c9ca
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use --os-endpoint-type for Cinder CLI

The --endpoint-type option has been deprecated in Cinder for several
years and was just recently removed. It was missed that the tempest lib
CLI code was still using that to specify the public URL. This updates
the Cinder CLI handling to use the more conventional --os-endpoint-type.

Change-Id: Icb81710a6b905d80c2e75b29be449dc029e01bdd
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Closes-bug: #1783885
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Make providers use auth_url for authentication

When reading credentials from the configuration's keystone_authtoken
section auth_uri was used as URL for Keystone.
As auth_uri is a public endpoint that is not necessarily reachable for
the Puppet agent, this change uses the more appropriate auth_url as
Keystone URL.

Change-Id: Ie3d3d78cc8699f25ef8507ac98255ff085481f0a

commit_message:
Change command for shell

The nspawn container destory command uses a pipe which is not allowed in
the command module. To correct this the shell module is used.

Change-Id: I7dacedfb62e9fd70d7b7c3130ac5af3d05711024
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Enable trusted certificates support
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-08-02 14:38:19.000000000', 'files': ['compute_hyperv/nova/imagecache.py', 'compute_hyperv/nova/driver.py', 'compute_hyperv/tests/fake_instance.py', 'compute_hyperv/tests/unit/test_imagecache.py'], 'message': 'Enable trusted certificates support

A recent feature has been added, allowing users to specify
trusted certificates (e.g. as barbican secret ids). The idea is
to ensure that the certificates used to sign and validate the
glance image are actually trusted by the user.

In order to enable this feature within our driver, all we have to
do is pass the trusted certificate ids (stored as an instance
object attribute) to the method that fetches glance images.

Blueprint: nova-validate-certificates

Change-Id: Ic28f2b3ecf4ca92dcb7e9643c6e0d207d40b5287
'}]
commit_message:
Enable trusted certificates support

A recent feature has been added, allowing users to specify
trusted certificates (e.g. as barbican secret ids). The idea is
to ensure that the certificates used to sign and validate the
glance image are actually trusted by the user.

In order to enable this feature within our driver, all we have to
do is pass the trusted certificate ids (stored as an instance
object attribute) to the method that fetches glance images.

Blueprint: nova-validate-certificates

Change-Id: Ic28f2b3ecf4ca92dcb7e9643c6e0d207d40b5287

subject: trivial: Changes files Windows style line ending to Unix style
revisions:

Recently, a new pep8 rule (H903) was introduced which checks for Windows
style endings. Because of this, Zuul is failing the pep8 job.

The files were converting using dos2unix.

Change-Id: I7ea5bf692ca19895046cb0803ea9c833b19eafc7
'}]
commit_message:
trivial: Changes files Windows style line ending to Unix style

Recently, a new pep8 rule (H903) was introduced which checks for Windows
style endings. Because of this, Zuul is failing the pep8 job.

The files were converting using dos2unix.

Change-Id: I7ea5bf692ca19895046cb0803ea9c833b19eafc7

commit_message:
Add doc about to delete ~/.quickstart directory before re-running quickstart.sh

Deploy will fail if reusing ~/.quickstart directory. It can be automatically deleted
running the quickstart.sh script using the -X flag

Change-Id: I0e33c5d12d83d1f1916e8fbf836005cfc39f5da0
Implements: bug
Closes-Bug: #1742149

We need to be able to define preconditions so that it can be started only
if all configured preconditions are met. It would give ability to wait for
another workflow till it ends, only start workflow if another workflow is
running or even pause/cancel another workflow as a precondition.

Change-Id: I43dc9769523ee73c87c3b3c0ff7a6e5c8ff45c43
'}]
commit_message:
Workflow preconditions

We need to be able to define preconditions so that it can be started only
if all configured preconditions are met. It would give ability to wait for
another workflow till it ends, only start workflow if another workflow is
running or even pause/cancel another workflow as a precondition.

Change-Id: I43dc9769523ee73c87c3b3c0ff7a6e5c8ff45c43

subject: Introduce customisable user_context beside openstack related MistralContext
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-06 08:43:24.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/context.py'], 'message': 'Introduce customisable user_context beside openstack related MistralContext

It would be very nice if custom actions could access to custom runtime execution context.
In some cases existing env is a good choice but sometimes if every execution needs
different context/env it could be a nightmare to manage env per execution or pass these
parameters down to each sub-workflow. Cloud authentication related context (MistralContext)
already addressed this issue, but it is not flexible enough.

Later may we need separate cloud credential from user_context.

Missing from current implementation:
- yaql function to reach user_context explicitly.

Change-Id: I517d6eb24b15dadb6ca402076a026e6abfbda637
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce customisable user_context beside openstack related MistralContext

It would be very nice if custom actions could access to custom runtime execution context.
In some cases existing env is a good choice but sometimes if every execution needs
different context/env it could be a nightmare to manage env per execution or pass these
parameters down to each sub-workflow. Cloud authentication related context (MistralContext)
already addressed this issue, but it is not flexible enough.

Later may we need separate cloud credential from user_context.

Missing from current implementation:
- yaql function to reach user_context explicitly.

Change-Id: I517d6eb24b15dadb6ca402076a026e6abfbda637

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-11-08 09:31:53.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/api/controllers/v2/action.py', 'requirements.txt', 'mistral/_i18n.py', 'mistral/config.py', 'mistral/coordination.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/execution.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/member.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add oslo.i18n module in mistral project

1.Add oslo.i18n module.

2.Help messages and output info should support oslo.i18n.

  LOG.info()/LOG.critical().

The more information as follow:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Partial-Implements: blueprint mistral-stadium-i18n

commit_message:
Add oslo.i18n module in mistral project

1.Add oslo.i18n module.

2.Help messages and output info should support oslo.i18n.
  So we should use oslo.i18n in LOG.warning()/LOG.error()/
  LOG.info()/LOG.critical().

The more information as follow:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/usage.html

Change-Id: I535fe1af4e9d2afd06eb5900babae6ac48b6f48e
Partial-Implements: blueprint mistral-stadium-i18n

commit_message:
Replace test.attr with decorators.attr

Function 'tempest.test.attr()' has moved to 'tempest.lib.decorators
.attr()' in Pike and will be removed in a future version[1]. This patch
replaces the 'tempest.test.attr()' with the 'tempest.lib
.decorators.attr().'

commit_message:
[WIP] Add pagination options for workflows and actions

The workflow and action output is missing pagination options like:
* marker
* limit
* sort-keys
* sort-dirs

These options are added in this patch.

Change-Id: I3cf594c0fb4e340abce0967980f56556c89da195
Implements: blueprint add-pagination

devstack: deploy openshift registry on origin envs

OpenShift functionality greatly depends on the openshift registry
being present. This patch ensures that once kuryr is running, it
will get deployed.

subject: Wrap token to auth plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-17 11:37:38.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/actions/openstack/actions.py', 'mistral/context.py'], 'message': 'Wrap token to auth plugin

Recently novaclient moved to keystoneauth. When a token is passed to it,
an instance of Token auth plugin is used to handle it. The problem with
it is that it tries to reauthenticate using the token. It is not
possible with trust-scoped token.

To avoid it we need to use an auth plugin that will not try to
re-authenticate, but rather use the existing token. After that,
the plugin needs to be passed with the session to novaclient.

Change-Id: Iaf3dc062ea7b8dce62e7be9ad2463375ab070a9a
Closes-Bug: 1690787
'}]
commit_message:
Wrap token to auth plugin

Recently novaclient moved to keystoneauth. When a token is passed to it,
an instance of Token auth plugin is used to handle it. The problem with
it is that it tries to reauthenticate using the token. It is not
possible with trust-scoped token.

To avoid it we need to use an auth plugin that will not try to
re-authenticate, but rather use the existing token. After that,
the plugin needs to be passed with the session to novaclient.

Change-Id: Iaf3dc062ea7b8dce62e7be9ad2463375ab070a9a
Closes-Bug: 1690787

commit_message:
Don't monkeypatch the executor

Running custom actions withint the eventlet code implies
serious limitations. Best option here is not to monkeypatch
the executor at all.

Change-Id: Iee65b69473f696c8502f90b76c8979403ec82a5e
Closes-Bug: #1728552

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-14 01:40:48.000000000', 'files': ['specs/pike/approved/mistral-execution-event-subscription.rst'], 'message': "Add 'execution event publishing and subscription' spec

Allow 3rd party to subscribe to workflow execution events. Implement an event
notification service and instead of just publishing the events onto a message
queue (fire and forget), instantiate a 3rd party plugins to process and
publish the events and track whether the events have been successfully
processed. The plugin is intended to handle custom logic, processing,
endpoints, and authentication to the external system.

Change-Id: I8da6a359dff34cc86b63c5dbd77497573f6fdb66
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'execution event publishing and subscription' spec

Allow 3rd party to subscribe to workflow execution events. Implement an event
notification service and instead of just publishing the events onto a message
queue (fire and forget), instantiate a 3rd party plugins to process and
publish the events and track whether the events have been successfully
processed. The plugin is intended to handle custom logic, processing,
endpoints, and authentication to the external system.

Change-Id: I8da6a359dff34cc86b63c5dbd77497573f6fdb66

subject: Removes SG rules on port with SG disabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-02 13:05:03.000000000', 'files': ['networking_hyperv/neutron/security_groups_driver.py', 'networking_hyperv/tests/unit/neutron/test_security_groups_driver.py'], 'message': "Removes SG rules on port with SG disabled

The SecurityGroupsDriver relies on its cache when removing a port's
ACL rules if the port's port_security_enabled field is False.

If the port was updated while the agent was down, the cache will be
empty, and thus skip removing the port's ACLs.

This patch addresses this issue by removing all of the port's ACLs if
the port's port_security_enabled is False.

Change-Id: Ibda80fbd17310e13ceb7fe4e6db7f68e6403e87b
Closes-Bug: #1747666
(cherry picked from commit 13a1d75fe79dc05c7822625b29fe07554855d70e)
"}]
commit_message:
Removes SG rules on port with SG disabled

The SecurityGroupsDriver relies on its cache when removing a port's
ACL rules if the port's port_security_enabled field is False.

If the port was updated while the agent was down, the cache will be
empty, and thus skip removing the port's ACLs.

This patch addresses this issue by removing all of the port's ACLs if
the port's port_security_enabled is False.

Change-Id: Ibda80fbd17310e13ceb7fe4e6db7f68e6403e87b
Closes-Bug: #1747666
(cherry picked from commit 13a1d75fe79dc05c7822625b29fe07554855d70e)

commit_message:
update requirements for neutron-lib 1.18.0

Neutron-lib 1.18.0 is our Rocky RC and is already being used by neutron
[1]. This patch updates the neutron-lib required version to match
neutron [1] in prep for the Rocky release.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583671/

Change-Id: I7d0530e4f6d2e2281e55daa958805f2cfa158c77

Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I5f4b45587b63c6132ac974eb65f7fd83b62ef1a8

commit_message:
Add custom-context-for-executions spec

Extend the context with custom parameters to make it
generally available for custom actions and support
the separation of OpenStack actions from the core.

Change-Id: If5ea987f3d9d70c288b12f549434f9e8d6853c66

commit_message:
Replace openshift_node_labels with openshift_node_group_name

Checking openshift-ansible looks like they have deprectaed
openshift_node_labels and now we have to use
openshift_node_group_name [1]

[1] https://github.com/openshift/openshift-ansible

Depends-On: Ifd3ca960ca618c2f32b3513d9913123a90ec8eac
Change-Id: I3c4da95153f16fab33a6ebcdca190ec1f00cf964

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-08-03 15:53:12.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/rocky-deprecate-some-upgrade-levels-options-bbe19bb2256e25ad.yaml', 'nova/conf/upgrade_levels.py'], 'message': 'Deprecate upgrade_levels options for deprecated/removed services

* nova-cert was removed in Pike: 2bcee77e3

* nova-network has been deprecated since newton: 7d5fc4868

* nova-consoleauth was deprecated in rocky: e91dad3ee

So start the timer on the related upgrade_levels options

Change-Id: Ied416335d36fe3324fb1c5c78353affe1332ba90
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate upgrade_levels options for deprecated/removed services

* nova-cert was removed in Pike: 2bcee77e3

* nova-network has been deprecated since newton: 7d5fc4868

* nova-consoleauth was deprecated in rocky: e91dad3ee

So start the timer on the related upgrade_levels options
so we can remove them.

Change-Id: Ied416335d36fe3324fb1c5c78353affe1332ba90

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-19 06:50:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': 'Resource tracker: remove costly copy

In the resource tracker periodic task the code does a deepcopy
for the stats. This is very costly and copies the structure N times
(where N is the amount of running instances on the host).

Change-Id: I53940d8dd3735dec1cf1d0bdae2216ff42853ba2
Closes-bug: #1777422
'}]
commit_message:
Resource tracker: remove costly copy

In the resource tracker periodic task the code does a deepcopy
for the stats. This is very costly and copies the structure N times
(where N is the amount of running instances on the host).

Change-Id: I53940d8dd3735dec1cf1d0bdae2216ff42853ba2
Closes-bug: #1777422

subject: Clarify what an exception from an action means
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-07-31 14:00:20.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/executors/default_executor.py'], 'message': "Clarify what an exception from an action means

When Python actions raise an exception they may not have failed to run.
This may not even be an issue. For example, the OpenStack action
`swift.head_container` will raise an exception is the container doesn't
exist.

This change lowers the exception to a warning but keeps the exception
traceback in the logs. It also changes the wording in the message. We
didn't fail to run the action, rather the action raise an exception.

Change-Id: If9a6a3b98999acae8b80ad4ddeb9d197a628c280
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify what an exception from an action means

When Python actions raise an exception they may not have failed to run.
This may not even be an issue. For example, the OpenStack action
`swift.head_container` will raise an exception is the container doesn't
exist.

This change lowers the exception to a warning but keeps the exception
traceback in the logs. It also changes the wording in the message. We
didn't fail to run the action, rather the action raise an exception.

Change-Id: If9a6a3b98999acae8b80ad4ddeb9d197a628c280

Change-Id: I1060e2ccdb1ef8ae1e8f1f682fc5d115d129c3ca
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid server_check_teardown exception breaking tearDown

server_check_teardown will raise Exception which will prevent
other cleanup steps from being executed(i.e., those added with
addCleanup), so server_check_teardown should be called after
super's tearDown.

Change-Id: I1060e2ccdb1ef8ae1e8f1f682fc5d115d129c3ca

subject: Add route when required on the local table
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-08-03 02:19:43.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nspawn_networking.yml'], 'message': "Add route when required on the local table

With the use of nspawn containers and macvlans, without an intermediary
bridge, there's no way to send traffic from the host back to the
container without configuring VEPA and having 802.1qg enabled
switches. To enhance the usability of nspawn a local route is added to
macvlan devices when an interface address is detected. This allows
the host to route back to the containers without issues and will not
interfere with the main host route. To ensure there's absolutely no
conflict with host routes a metric has added to all routes added to the
local table.

Change-Id: Id4326c9783f46884d3f39692e691775ba1118b38
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add route when required on the local table

With the use of nspawn containers and macvlans, without an intermediary
bridge, there's no way to send traffic from the host back to the
container without configuring VEPA and having 802.1qg enabled
switches. To enhance the usability of nspawn a local route is added to
macvlan devices when an interface address is detected. This allows
the host to route back to the containers without issues and will not
interfere with the main host route. To ensure there's absolutely no
conflict with host routes a metric has added to all routes added to the
local table.

Change-Id: Id4326c9783f46884d3f39692e691775ba1118b38
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Unpin ceph-ansible and add ceph-ansible library path

The ceph-ansible project has created a new library which
is held in the root folder. We need to ensure that the
library path is included.

Additionally, a callback plugins directory exists within ceph-ansible
that we should also import.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/587198
Change-Id: Ic70d0e9eb57be9a9a1d8a658ceacc50c47ab9c02
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
(cherry picked from commit 8c8e4beda733648946140a5a14d23a346d3b5292)

Update the default admission control list

The recommended admission controller list is:
NamespaceLifecycle,LimitRanger,ServiceAccount,DefaultStorageClass,
DefaultTolerationSeconds,MutatingAdmissionWebhook,
ValidatingAdmissionWebhook,ResourceQuota

[0] https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/admission-controllers/#is-there-a-recommended-set-of-admission-controllers-to-use

Change-Id: I663804d93d5ff8dc70171bcd7d61b2d92c8616e1

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: I061b2e278b9eaacb632459e1dc9e1de54b1be13f
Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Hai <nguyentrihai93@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-01 08:38:34.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/tests/unit/api/v1/test_vim.py', 'tacker/tests/unit/test_attributes.py', 'tacker/api/v1/attributes.py', 'tacker/extensions/nfvo.py'], 'message': 'Fix VIM register API 500 error issue

If user passes non-dict or empty dict to the auth_cred and
vim_project parameters, then tacker returns 500 error.

This patch fixes the issue by adding a new validator type
"dict_not_empty" and using at the required places. Now, if
users passes non-dict or empty dict to VIM Register API,
then it will return 400(BadRequest) error.

Change-Id: Ic144df6af606286ed3eea7f7071f061bceffaa7f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix VIM register API 500 error issue

If user passes non-dict or empty dict to the auth_cred and
vim_project parameters, then tacker returns 500 error.

This patch fixes the issue by adding a new validator type
"dict_not_empty" and using at the required places. Now, if
users passes non-dict or empty dict to VIM Register API,
then it will return 400(BadRequest) error.

Change-Id: Ic144df6af606286ed3eea7f7071f061bceffaa7f

Change-Id: Ie5b10b20f11f109bb7159d43a0f5303508b00f78

commit_message:
devstack check neutron-qos available

check neutron-qos available before adding neutron_qos data source
to Congress. Avoids the data source update errors arising from
adding the data source when the qos extension is not available.

Release-team: devstack plugin change only

commit_message:
Pass microversion info through from Profile

Even though Profile is going away, senlinclient is still using it.
There is a patch up to fix that, but in the meantime, let's fix it for
their issue. api_version in Profile is the variable for setting a
default microversion, but the translation method didn't set it.

Story: 2003146
Change-Id: I6efd25959127bbe28e76b1967caa5b3716346c7e

commit_message:
Fix error about kibana restart failed

Because kibana has no permission to create "/opt/kibana/bin".
Use symlink to run kibana on RPM-based distro is not good.
In order to run different kibana executable file on different distro,
we can create a parameter named "kolla_default_executable" to solve it.

Close-Bugs: #1784546

Change-Id: I963bb0622cdeea3966f3fe682a5cbd733cc5c108
Signed-off-by: pengdake <19921207pq@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Enforce channel modes with accessbot

In the dependent change, accessbot gains the ability to set channel
modes.  Enforce our global mode of registered users only, with a
forward to #openstack-unregistered to catch those who need help with
nickserv.

Change-Id: I004f7c9c9093262bea6e841be41166d3b6ecfb10
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588134

subject: Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job
revisions:

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for

- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: Ib93224c3f261d52499c0e4900bb32da907eb69bd

commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: Ib93224c3f261d52499c0e4900bb32da907eb69bd

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mostly mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of
moving the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each
project repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

The legacy-tempest-dsvm-full-zmq job is only used by this plugin, so
we move the playbook and job definition here as well. It needs to be
renamed in order to be moved and applied to the repository, so the new
name devstack-plugin-zmq-tempest-full is used to indicate that it is
defined within the repository.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I3d80c8a576fa4cbedffdaaf6cf97a4a61a2dce34
Story: #2003250

subject: Add ceph-ansible library and callback path
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-30 19:21:02.000000000', 'files': ['test-ansible-env-prep.sh', 'test-ansible.cfg'], 'message': 'Add ceph-ansible library and callback path

The ceph-ansible project has created a new library which
is held in the root folder. We need to ensure that the
library path is included.

Additionally a callback plugins directory inside plugins/callback has
been added, along with an action plugins directory inside
plugins/actions.

Finally, the sed command we use to replace the default roles directory
was causing issues in that it applied to any lines that were not
necessarily the roles_path. This PR adjusts the sed to ensure it is only
the roles_path line that is replaced.

Change-Id: I0d30d749ef2e00c1d199e53a837462619a9b2650
(cherry picked from commit 0943a630bb303d9badf9edfdcc466abf1c211304)
'}]
commit_message:
Add ceph-ansible library and callback path

The ceph-ansible project has created a new library which
is held in the root folder. We need to ensure that the
library path is included.

Additionally a callback plugins directory inside plugins/callback has
been added, along with an action plugins directory inside
plugins/actions.

Finally, the sed command we use to replace the default roles directory
was causing issues in that it applied to any lines that were not
necessarily the roles_path. This PR adjusts the sed to ensure it is only
the roles_path line that is replaced.

Change-Id: I0d30d749ef2e00c1d199e53a837462619a9b2650
(cherry picked from commit 0943a630bb303d9badf9edfdcc466abf1c211304)

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-22 16:38:31.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5bef9cf872f0d515c1bdfedb157febf6a0194362
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5bef9cf872f0d515c1bdfedb157febf6a0194362

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I30bc962aacc4e6b12835b36c6bd074ae0c988b04

subject: Fix repeat ID problem in library policy display
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-01 04:12:38.000000000', 'files': ['congress_dashboard/library/views.py'], 'message': "Fix repeat ID problem in library policy display

In library policy dashboard, sometimes the same rule is
repeated multiple times, overwriting some subsequent rules.
For example, in Policy Details: TagBasedNetworkSecurityZone,
the first two rules displays as

security_zone_tags('demo_zone'),
security_zone_tags('demo_zone')

rather than the correct

security_zone_tags('demo_zone'),
security_zone_tags('production_zone').

This patch fixes the issue by making sure a distinct ID is

Change-Id: I20d758ec4dffeaecf60f6c60c401bb08e359def5
Closes-Bug: 1784770
"}]
commit_message:
Fix repeat ID problem in library policy display

In library policy dashboard, sometimes the same rule is
repeated multiple times, overwriting some subsequent rules.
For example, in Policy Details: TagBasedNetworkSecurityZone,
the first two rules displays as

security_zone_tags('demo_zone'),
security_zone_tags('demo_zone')

rather than the correct

security_zone_tags('demo_zone'),
security_zone_tags('production_zone').

This patch fixes the issue by making sure a distinct ID is
assigned to each rule for django.

Change-Id: I20d758ec4dffeaecf60f6c60c401bb08e359def5
Closes-Bug: 1784770

commit_message:
Deprecate of_interface for ovs

The parameter of_interface was use for OpenFlow
interfaces. This parameter is deprecated in neutron
project so it can be deprecated also in puppet.

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-08-04 16:38:42.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I2468719d194af09dd7048015f173b0335f64371f
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I2468719d194af09dd7048015f173b0335f64371f

subject: Send disk_over_commit if nova api < 2.25
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-25 01:19:08.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/compute/v2/server.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_server.py'], 'message': 'Send disk_over_commit if nova api < 2.25

Previously, disk_over_commit was not exposed and was defaulted to
False. At least one future SDK user (openstackclient) will need
disk_over_commit support from the SDK. This patch adds
disk_over_commit to the live_migrate parameters, and sends it to the
server if running with api < 2.25.

Story: #2002963
Task: #23177
'}]
commit_message:
Send disk_over_commit if nova api < 2.25

Previously, disk_over_commit was not exposed and was defaulted to
False. At least one future SDK user (openstackclient) will need
disk_over_commit support from the SDK. This patch adds
disk_over_commit to the live_migrate parameters, and sends it to the
server if running with api < 2.25.

Change-Id: I3f1c6eab41432b9db79ad147cfac3ff63eb70efa
Story: #2002963
Task: #23177

revisions:

mark the stack as failed. If we don't do this then any error or exception

Story: #2003125
Task: 23245
"}]
commit_message:
Handle exceptions in initial convergence traversal setup

If an exception occurs while doing the initial setup of a convergence
traversal (including sending the check_resource messages for leaf nodes),
mark the stack as failed. If we don't do this then any error or exception
in this method will cause the stack to hang IN_PROGRESS.

Change-Id: Ib8231321e823634a3dc23cff9a1c7d560f64fd6e
Story: #2003125
Task: 23245

subject: Check with previous status when delete nested stack
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-05-10 12:09:50.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_resource.py'], 'message': 'Check with previous status when delete nested stack

Add previous status for deleting stack resource and use it to
check against current status. This will help to reduce some chances
of race condition (like when we check status with stack status and
find it failed when actual action not yet setting the status for
new action).
Also to avoid checking against a already in deleted stack
(like delete the child stack first in nested stack), we should just
mark as complete when we find the stack status is delete complete.
Story: #1669608
Task: #17214

Change-Id: Ie4542d7b20a3b1ba7ebe853408419418bd1ee194
'}]
commit_message:
Check with previous status when delete nested stack

Add previous status for deleting stack resource and use it to
check against current status. This will help to reduce some chances
of race condition (like when we check status with stack status and
find it failed when actual action not yet setting the status for
new action).
Also to avoid checking against a already in deleted stack
(like delete the child stack first in nested stack), we should just
mark as complete when we find the stack status is delete complete.
Story: #1669608
Task: #17214

Change-Id: Ie4542d7b20a3b1ba7ebe853408419418bd1ee194

commit_message:
Log traceback on errors in Watcher

This commit makes sure exception is logged with traceback when an error
happened in Watcher (e.g. when processing the event).

Change-Id: I54909622dae5e05e63576e4b504650b6c3fcb5c5

Remove old artifacts from Essex

The openstack-chef-repo will be migrated here for documentation and
integration, and deployment examples. Remove the old data in
preparation.

commit_message:
Update several Dell EMC driver paths

Update the driver paths for following Dell EMC backends:
- Dell SC
- EMC VMAX
- EMC VNX
- EMC Xtremio

Closes-Bug: #1785085

subject: ssh-key should land in $HOME
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-08-03 20:36:20.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-octavia.yml'], 'message': "ssh-key should land in $HOME

During a gate test I discovered that the ssh key wasn't
generated in /root/.ssh but /home/zuul - causing an error.
This will create the key in the home directory of the user.

Change-Id: Ic095d0d05342c93f6be52b7f44bf2082d2556780
"}]
commit_message:
ssh-key should land in $HOME

During a gate test I discovered that the ssh key wasn't
generated in /root/.ssh but /home/zuul - causing an error.
This will create the key in the home directory of the user.

Change-Id: Ic095d0d05342c93f6be52b7f44bf2082d2556780

subject: Fix lxc image preparation for bionic
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2018-08-04 10:33:57.000000000', 'files': ['templates/prep-scripts/ubuntu_18_prep.sh.j2', 'templates/prep-scripts/_container_sys_setup.sh.j2'], 'message': 'Fix lxc image preparation for bionic

Ensure that the devices required for apt are present. Ensure
that the required directories for gpg-agent are present. Ensure
that the gpg-agent is running.

Change-Id: Iaa82d44c041ca5f83e6ba7b99af3dfacef8af369
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix lxc image preparation for bionic

Ensure that the devices required for apt are present. Ensure
that the required directories for gpg-agent are present. Ensure
that the gpg-agent is running.

Change-Id: Iaa82d44c041ca5f83e6ba7b99af3dfacef8af369
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

commit_message:
Add LVM thin pool support

Allow the LVM image backend to support specification of an LVM
thin pool, which can be used along with the volume group name
to thin provision logical volume extents when creating new
logvols.

Implements: blueprint lvm-thin-pool
Change-Id: I8f42659bb076ef6fb2ae7805026f891926be6676

commit_message:
Keystone: Stop running keystone container with root user

This PS updates the keystoen chart to stop running the keystone api
as the root user.

Change-Id: If3042210f761476846da02fc8e648c700267a591
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
clarify usage of upgrade_levels group

clarify usage of upgrade_levels group especially to note
other than upgrade_levels.compute that can't use 'auto'.

Closes-Bug: 1781916

Change-Id: I23ae3895d63a4f6aa40b4a17822270da7cd5b9e3
